Class ViewerSecurityManager

java.lang.Object
  com.enterprise_architecture.essential.report.security.ViewerSecurityManager

public class ViewerSecurityManager
extends java.lang.Object

Class to manage the interface and connection to the User Management Service

Jonathan Carter

ViewerSecurityManager

public ViewerSecurityManager(javax.servlet.ServletContext theServletContext)
Method Detail

authenticateUserBySession

public java.lang.String authenticateUserBySession(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest theRequest)
Authenticate the user. Check for user information in the session. If nothing found, returns NULL, in which case the login authentication process or check for user token should be used.

Returns:
an XML document representing the user's custom data, including all their clearance levels. Or null if no session exists

authenticateUserByToken

public java.lang.String authenticateUserByToken(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest theRequest)
Authenticate the user, looking for a user token in the request

Parameters:
theRequest - the user request received by the Secure Viewer
Returns:
an XML document representing the user's custom data, including all their clearance levels. Or null if no token exists

authenticateUserByToken

public java.lang.String authenticateUserByToken(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest theRequest,
                                                java.lang.String theUserToken)
looking for a user token in the request

Parameters:
theRequest - the user request received by the Secure Viewer
theUserToken - as retrieved from the user request via the #USER_ACCOUNT_URL parameter
Returns:
an XML document representing the user's custom data, including all their clearance levels. Or null if no token exists

authenticateUserByLogin

public java.lang.String authenticateUserByLogin(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest theRequest,
                                                java.lang.String theTenantName,
                                                java.lang.String theUsername,
                                                java.lang.String thePassword)
Authenticate the user based on their login credentials

Parameters:
theTenant - the tenant to which the user account belongs
theUsername - the username (e.g. email address)
thePassword - the user's password
Returns:
an XML document representing the user's custom data, including all their clearance levels. Or null if credentials are not accepted

getUserData

public java.lang.String getUserData(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest theRequest)
Get the custom data for the user's account and return it in XML form, defined by vieweruserdata.xsd

Returns:
XML document representing relevant user data including all clearance levels

isUserAuthorisedForViewer

public boolean isUserAuthorisedForViewer(java.lang.String theAccount,
                                         java.lang.String theRepositoryURI,
                                         java.lang.String theViewerName)
Check whether the user is authorised to access this viewer

Parameters:
theUserAccount - XML representation
theRepositoryURI - the ID of the repository that is being provided by this viewer
theViewerName - the name of the Viewer web application, e.g. 'essential_viewer'
Returns:
true if authorised, false if not

isUserAuthorisedForPublish

public boolean isUserAuthorisedForPublish(java.lang.String theUserURI,
                                          java.lang.String theRepositoryURI)
Check whether the user is authorised to publish to this Viewer

Parameters:
theUserURI - the user ID
theRepositoryURI - the ID of the repository that is being published
Returns:
true if authorised, false if not

isUserAuthorisedForImport

public boolean isUserAuthorisedForImport(java.lang.String theUserURI)
Check whether the user is authorised to use the Import Utility

Parameters:
theUserURI - the user ID
Returns:
true if authorised, false if not

isUserSystemAdminForViewer

public boolean isUserSystemAdminForViewer(java.lang.String theAccount,
                                          java.lang.String theViewerName)
Check to see whether the user can access the specified viewer and has a system admin role

Parameters:
theAccount - the XML representation of the user Account information, e.g. from their session
theViewerName - the name of the Viewer that they are administering
Returns:
true if the account has correct system admin role

Returns:
an XML document representing the user's custom data, including all their clearance levels

Returns:

isGroupForViewer

protected boolean isGroupForViewer(java.lang.String theViewerName,
                                   java.lang.String theGroupURL)
Compare the specified viewer name with the URL custom data from a Group. If they match, then this is the Group for the viewer

Parameters:
theViewerName - the name of the current viewer application, with its full URL
theGroupURL - the full URL for a Viewer Group
Returns:
true if theViewerName is the same as theGroupURL

Parameters:
theTenantName - the name of the tenant
Returns:
the Directory for the specified tenant

Parameters:

Returns:
the resource ID

isAdTenantUser

protected com.stormpath.sdk.account.Account isAdTenantUser(com.stormpath.sdk.directory.Directory theTenantDir,
                                                           java.lang.String theUserName)
Check whether the specified Tenant Directory is a mirror of an AD synchronised directory

Parameters:
theTenantDir - the Tenant Directory
theUserName - the username, which could be their email address but not necessarily
Returns:
Stormpath Account object for the user if this is a mirror, null if not

Parameters:
theDirectoryName -
Returns:
the directory or null if no matching directory is found
